<p><strong>The arrival of Alibaba’s Taobao Live in May 2016</strong> marked the opening of a new chapter in sales. The Chinese retail giant had pioneered a powerful new approach: linking up an online livestream broadcast with an e-commerce store to allow viewers to watch and shop at the same time. Live commerce quickly established itself as a fixture in sales campaigns for Singles’ Day—a major shopping event in China—and, more broadly, as a reliable digital tool for boosting customer engagement and sales. In 2020, the first 30 minutes of Alibaba’s Singles’ Day presales campaign on Taobao Live generated an impressive $7.5 billion in total transaction value.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="7c7078a6-de9c-4451-9e74-1b1886df63ce"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">1</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="7c7078a6-de9c-4451-9e74-1b1886df63ce" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Jane Zhang, “Alibaba’s Taobao Live hits US$7.5 billion in first 30 minutes of presales for Singles’ Day,” <em>South China Morning Post</em>, October 29, 2020, scmp.com.</span></span></span></a></span> Welcome to the next wave of the e-commerce revolution.</p>

data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c mdc-u-ts-3 SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-heading__NJekY"><div>About the authors</div></h2><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-description__4p9iI mdc-u-ts-7"><div class="mdc-o-content-body">This article was a collective effort by <a href="/our-people/arun-arora">Arun Arora</a>, Daniel Glaser, Aimee Kim, Philipp Kluge, <a href="/our-people/sajal-kohli">Sajal Kohli</a>, and Natalya Sak, representing views from McKinsey Digital and the Consumer Packaged Goods, Marketing & Sales, and Retail practices.</div></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>Live commerce combines instant purchasing of a featured product and audience participation through a chat function or reaction buttons. In China, live commerce has transformed the retail industry and established itself as a major sales channel in less than five years. In a 2020 survey, two-thirds of Chinese consumers said they had bought products via livestream in the past year.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="fce8e69d-2ae4-4992-bfd2-4fd7c089e215"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">2</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="fce8e69d-2ae4-4992-bfd2-4fd7c089e215" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Chinese consumers rally for Singles’ Day but plan to shun foreign brands, says AlixPartners survey,” AlixPartners, October 28, 2020, alixpartners.com.</span></span></span></a></span> While retailers overall in the West are still behind China in the pursuit of live commerce, early movers are also starting to rack up significant sales.</p>
<p>How exactly this new channel will develop remains to be seen. What is clear is that it holds enormous long-term potential for brands and e-commerce platforms alike. If China’s experience is any guide, our analysis indicates that live-commerce-initiated sales could account for as much as 10 to 20 percent of all e-commerce by 2026.</p>
<h2>How does live commerce create value?</h2>
<p>Live commerce can help brands, retailers, and marketplaces primarily in two areas:</p>
<p><em>Accelerating conversion.</em> Live commerce is entertaining and immersive, keeping viewers watching longer. It also telescopes <a href="/capabilities/growth-marketing-and-sales/our-insights/the-new-consumer-decision-journey">customer decision journeys</a> from awareness to purchase. Time-limited tactics such as one-off coupons can be used to generate a sense of urgency. Companies report conversion rates approaching 30 percent—up to ten times higher than in <a href="/featured-insights/mckinsey-explainers/what-is-e-commerce">conventional e-commerce</a>.</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-sm-right-span"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 1</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-1_inset.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="China's live commerce reached an estimated $171 billion in value in 2020." src="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-1_inset.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<p><em>Improving brand appeal and differentiation.</em> Done well, live commerce increases a brand’s appeal and distinctiveness and pulls in additional web traffic. It can strengthen positioning among existing customers and attract new ones, especially young people keen on innovative shopping formats and experiences. Some companies are seeing their share of younger audiences increase by up to 20 percent.</p>
<h2>A rapidly growing channel</h2>
<p>Live commerce has evolved rapidly in China, taking less than five years to develop into an innovative sales channel with an estimated penetration of 10 percent.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="3fbedc19-a155-4d48-9969-5b5c920e57b7"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">3</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="3fbedc19-a155-4d48-9969-5b5c920e57b7" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch. Penetration is defined as gross merchandise value (GMV) of livestreaming divided by total e-commerce GMV.</span></span></span></a></span> The value of China’s live-commerce market grew at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of more than 280 percent between 2017 and 2020, to reach an estimated $171 billion in 2020 (Exhibit 1).<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="b0224580-a509-4b64-8dcf-ec4cf31aaba5"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">4</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="b0224580-a509-4b64-8dcf-ec4cf31aaba5" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch.</span></span></span></a></span> This growth spurt has been intensified by the COVID-19 pandemic, and Chinese sales are expected to reach $423 billion by 2022.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="7e7965bb-6623-40b1-b7c2-63cd77935941"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">5</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="7e7965bb-6623-40b1-b7c2-63cd77935941" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>The product categories most often showcased in live commerce are apparel and fashion, with a 36 percent share, followed by beauty products and food, with roughly 7 percent each (Exhibit 2). Consumer electronics account for some 5 percent, and furnishing and home decor for almost 4 percent.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="916862db-e96e-475d-8000-fa944d746b72"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">6</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="916862db-e96e-475d-8000-fa944d746b72" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 2</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-2.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="Apparel and fashion is by the far the leading category in livestream events." src="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-2.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-outer__UdWCq"><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__eyebrow__5GSEq">Sidebar</div><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content__raEwe"><h2 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c mdc-u-ts-3 SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-heading__NJekY"><div>Key facts on the world’s biggest live-commerce player</div></h2><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-description__4p9iI mdc-u-ts-7"><div class="mdc-o-content-body"><p>On average for Taobao’s livestreams:</p>
<ul>
    <li>sessions at top accounts last, on average, for up to six hours and showcase around 70 different products</li>
    <li>top livestreamers display one product every five minutes</li>
    <li>sessions at top accounts attract, on average, 266,000 viewers, leading to roughly 75,000 orders</li>
    <li>sessions have a conversion rate of 28 percent (November 2020)</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<p>Source: Company website, press search, and McKinsey analysis</p></div></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>In terms of demographics, Generation Z and millennials dominate, although live commerce is starting to attract middle-aged and more-senior consumers. By March 2020, live commerce was used by 265 million people—almost 30 percent of Chinese Internet users.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="2651c6c5-67fb-4b22-9a59-d3ba85e85f04"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">7</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="2651c6c5-67fb-4b22-9a59-d3ba85e85f04" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC), <em>The 47th China Statistical Report on Internet Development</em>, February 2021, cnnic.com.cn.</span></span></span></a></span> Taobao remains the world’s biggest player (see sidebar “Key facts on the world’s biggest live-commerce player”), with a market share of 35 percent.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="dda1725a-ba73-4996-9118-8311f337d48b"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">8</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="dda1725a-ba73-4996-9118-8311f337d48b" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch and press reports.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>Following China’s lead, Western brands, retailers, and marketplaces are establishing their own live-commerce ventures and events to promote their products, especially in beauty and fashion. Among the earliest adopters was German beauty retailer Douglas, which streams several shows a week in a range of formats, from workshops with experts to talks with influencers, and reports conversion rates of up to 40 percent.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="8ea5e906-4c18-4669-8e1e-de2171e2d610"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">9</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="8ea5e906-4c18-4669-8e1e-de2171e2d610" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Solveig Gode, “‘Wie Teleshopping für die Generation Smartphone’: Warum Live-Streams die Zukunft des Online-Shoppings sind,” <em>Business Insider</em>, December 28, 2020, businessinsider.de.</span></span></span></a></span> On the fashion front, Tommy Hilfiger recently extended its livestream program to Europe and North America following successes in China, where one show reportedly attracted an audience of 14 million and sold 1,300 hoodies in two minutes.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="5c0c4bcb-336e-4c84-b433-7a0f185d0a65"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">10</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="5c0c4bcb-336e-4c84-b433-7a0f185d0a65" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“US brands adopt e-commerce livestreaming to boost sales,“ WARC, October 13, 2020, warc.com.</span></span></span></a></span> And in December 2020, Walmart piloted a livestream fashion event on TikTok that netted seven times more viewers than expected and enabled it to add 25 percent to its TikTok follower base.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="b5ab580d-7d22-4ee1-9d66-bd77ac631093"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">11</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="b5ab580d-7d22-4ee1-9d66-bd77ac631093" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Sara Perez, “Walmart to host a new livestream shopping event on TikTok, following successful pilot,” TechCrunch, March 9, 2021, techcrunch.com.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>A plethora of specialist start-ups have also emerged, including NTWRK, which features shows where guests talk about limited-availability streetwear, and Buywith, where viewers watch hosts browsing the e-commerce platform and chatting via webcam.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, consumer demand is building: a recent survey found that almost a quarter of adults outside China would like to discover new products via a livestream featuring an influencer or brand representative.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="173ac6f5-68e7-496e-8814-b4c91c578cc7"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">12</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="173ac6f5-68e7-496e-8814-b4c91c578cc7" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Facebook IQ, “The future of shopping has come early: Perspectives from the industry,” conducted by GfK, October 29, 2020, facebook.com/business.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<h2>Starting out in live commerce</h2>
<p>While live commerce is still an emerging channel with many unknowns, some best practices are emerging, and lessons from e-commerce are proving to be applicable. Brands will need a thoughtful approach to learning how to use the medium—it can be expensive to do live commerce during Singles’ Day, for example, so best to try low-risk options first—and evolve their capabilities as they learn (see sidebar “Three live-commerce archetypes”).</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="light" data-module-background="lightest-grey" data-module-category="" data-module-gradient-position="bottom-right" class="mck-c-inline-module-container SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__bgimg-wrapper__Qj4Dt mck-o-edge-to-edge mck-u-screen-only mck-c-module-wrapper" data-layer-region="sidebar"><style></style><div data-component="mdc-c-background-image" class="mdc-c-bg-image___GJdv1_990311c background-image-sidebarBg-3e8ad149-6fed-4d01-a336-1c7f459672f9 SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__scrolling-bg__m0W_L" role="img" aria-label="Three live-commerce archetypes"></div><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__scrolling-wrapper__U9X9c mdc-o-container__wrapper  mdc-u-spaced-mobile "><div class="mdc-o-container__wrapper is-wrapped mdc-u-grid-gutter-md mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-col-sm-12"><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-sm-span-12 mdc-u-grid-col-md-span-12 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-span-4  SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-sticky__k5JFm mck-c-sidebar__scrolling-heading" style="opacity: 0; transform: translate(0px, 100px);"><h2 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c mdc-u-ts-3 SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-heading__NJekY"><div>Three live-commerce archetypes </div></h2><div data-component="mdc-c-link-container" class="mdc-c-link-container___xefGu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs"><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__next-heading__ZYaa2">Continue to next section </div><button data-component="mdc-c-button" aria-label="" type="button" id="button_id" class="mdc-c-button___U4iY2_990311c mdc-c-button--ghost mdc-c-button--size-medium SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__arrow-down__JAGOH"><span data-component="mdc-c-icon" class="mdc-c-icon___oi7ef_990311c mdc-c-icon--size-lg___5rPck_990311c mck-arrow-down-icon"></span></button></div></div><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-sm-span-12 mdc-u-grid-col-md-span-12 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-start-6 SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-sticky__k5JFm"><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__scroll-share__FVQ34"><div data-component="mdc-c-dropdown-menu" class="mdc-c-drop-down"><button data-component="mdc-c-button" aria-label="" type="button" id="floating-ui-5" class="mdc-c-button___U4iY2_990311c mdc-c-button--ghost mdc-c-button--size-medium mdc-c-drop-down__rootmenu___yJzvz_990311c" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="menu"><span data-component="mdc-c-icon" class="mdc-c-icon___oi7ef_990311c mdc-c-icon--default___f-hQM_990311c mdc-c-icon--size-md___yi5fA_990311c mck-share2-icon"></span><span>Share</span></button><div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="light" data-module-background="white" data-module-category="" class=""></div></div></div><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__black-background__tPdB_"><div class="SideBar_mck-c-sidebar__content-description__4p9iI mdc-u-ts-7"><div class="mdc-o-content-body"><p>Live-commerce practices should match the degree of a company’s maturity in the field. Companies tend to fall into three basic archetypes:</p>

<p><strong>1. BASIC: Testing the waters</strong></p>

<ul>
    <li>Have infrequent streams focused on one to five products</li>
    <li>Rely on the technology of one social-media channel (such as TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook) or marketplace (such as Amazon Live, Taobao, or Tmall)</li>
    <li>Provide high-level brand guidelines to a key opinion leader (KOL) or key opinion customer (KOC) who (with their agency) owns content creation</li>
    <li>Track performance of livestreams with key performance indicators (KPIs) in place for numbers of views, conversion rates, and best-selling products</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>2. GOOD: Making live commerce a pillar of e-commerce</strong></p>
<ul>
    <li>Experiment with a regular schedule of live events with varying products, formats, and target audiences</li>
    <li>Integrate livestreaming into its own website or e-commerce experience to “own” the customer</li>
    <li>Track livestream performance using real-time predictive analytics to derive insights into audiences, content, products, formats, hosts, and timing</li>
    <li>Use a dedicated in-house team or agency staff to plan and develop content for livestreams, including storylines, scripts, and hosts or influencers</li>
    <li>Make a full-time team responsible for managing the live-commerce channel</li>
    <li>Set up automated performance-marketing campaigns to drive target traffic to relevant streams</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>3. GREAT: Scaling up to an innovative data-driven business</strong></p>
<ul>
    <li>Broadcast frequent livestreams across multiple channels using various formats targeting different audience segments and product categories</li>
    <li>Use analytics-derived insights and machine learning to develop automated real-time prompts for optimizing livestreams as they go out</li>
    <li>Integrate tech innovations such as augmented and virtual reality into livestreams to make them more immersive for viewers</li>
    <li>Have a fully-fledged live-commerce department with a broad network of KOLs and KOCs who have proved they can run livestreams on their own</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>Our analysis has shown that focusing on answering the following questions can help put brands on the right track.</p>
<h3>Which product and audience?</h3>
<p>Consider which stage a product has reached in its life cycle. Are you seeking to generate instant feedback on a new product, clear stock of an older item, or give a bestseller an extra boost? Our observations suggest that live events can be highly effective for creating awareness and prompting trial but less so for solidifying loyalty. It’s worth noting that many impulse shoppers are one-time buyers, so a newly attracted audience can’t be taken for granted; keeping it will take work. Similarly, our experience has shown that shoppers often come from a very different demographic than the brand’s typical target group.</p>
<p>To ensure that your show attracts the consumer segments most relevant to your brand, it’s critical to know who makes up your audience, what matters to them, and how to get their attention. Using analytics sources and tools to understand who has watched your content in the past can help you build up “personas” of potential customers to guide your choices on your target demographic. In broad terms, Generation X and Generation Z shop—and spend—more online than other groups, but it pays to dig into the data at a more granular level.</p>
<p>In fashion, beauty, and luxury goods, for instance, millennials are the top-spending cohort, with 31 percent of the US market, according to McKinsey analysis. Boomers come in second, with 25 percent, followed by Gen X at 24 percent and Gen Z at 20 percent. But category by category, the picture becomes more complex: Generation Z spends more on luxury apparel and accessories than millennials do, for instance (averaging $926 and $789, respectively).<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="d04fa44b-2b65-4a75-895b-0ed24dcdcb58"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">13</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="d04fa44b-2b65-4a75-895b-0ed24dcdcb58" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey New Age of the Consumer Survey, 2019.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>Knowing your audience also means knowing who and what most influence them. Adults in Gen Z derive 75 percent of their influences from social media, online content, and celebrities; millennials are a bit behind, at 63 percent, followed by Gen Z under-18s at 53 percent and Gen X at 49 percent (Exhibit 3). As these younger cohorts age, their spending power will grow, as will their presence. Millennials, for instance, are projected to account for half of the population globally by 2030.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="32252d7b-91fb-429e-aa7a-d41d533b0d73"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">14</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="32252d7b-91fb-429e-aa7a-d41d533b0d73" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Population Dynamics data tables.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 3</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-3.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="Social media is the single biggest influence on Gen Z consumers." src="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/its%20showtime%20how%20live%20commerce%20is%20transforming%20the%20shopping%20experience/svg-live-commerce-exhibit-3.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<p>Product launches or presentations can attract attention to a new product and convert interest instantly into sales, making them a good choice for seasonal marketing campaigns and exclusive or special deals. To trigger impulse purchases, products need to look good on small and large screens and be positioned as good value for the money.</p>
<h3>Which format?</h3>
<p>To set up a livestream event, companies typically engage a key opinion leader (KOL) or key opinion consumer (KOC) to host the show, introduce the product, and interact with the audience to trigger sales. Several popular formats have emerged, each with its own strengths:</p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Tutorials,</em> such as makeup demonstrations hosted by models, are effective not only in showing audiences how to apply or use a specific product but also in suggesting how to combine it with other products, opening up cross-selling opportunities.</li>
    <li><em>Interviews</em> with a big name or influencer from a relevant segment feel more personal, authentic, and genuine than product launches and can be good for building awareness and driving traffic.</li>
    <li><em>“Behind-the-scenes”</em> videos offering the inside story of a product or company help build brand image and loyalty in a target segment—an ethical fashion retailer, for instance, might showcase its sustainable supply chain to environmentally and socially conscious consumers.</li>
</ul>
<p>Regardless of format, many successful events feature interactive elements such as games, quizzes, and giveaways to keep viewers engaged and entertained. They maintain high production values in photography, location, lighting, and sound and ensure that scripts are not overly focused on the product.</p>
<h3>Which enablers?</h3>
<p>Planning a live-commerce event also involves deciding on the following:</p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Technology.</em> The key technology choice is which platform or marketplace to use for hosting the stream and providing e-commerce functionality. Some providers offer one of these functions; others, such as Instagram and Facebook, offer both. The right choice depends on a business’s level of maturity with live commerce. It also involves considering which technology provides the biggest target audience, which features it offers (live chat, “likes,” and so on), and the level of commission to be paid. Companies with more experience in live commerce can switch to an off-the-shelf solution, such as Livescale or Bambuser, that allows them to tailor the live-shopping experience to suit their brand, syndicate to multiple social-media channels, and offer their customers seamless purchasing from the same page. Companies that want to fully customize the customer experience and functionality often build their own solution.</li>
    <li><em>Tracking.</em> As in e-commerce, effective monitoring and measuring of event impact by audience, day part, and so on is crucial to understanding what works and what doesn’t. It is important that the live-commerce operating model be flexible enough to act quickly on that data. After a show, for example, it’s possible to send a link to a recording of the show to a viewer who watched for just 20 seconds, or to offer someone who stayed for ten minutes a discount to convert their interest into a purchase. A one-off coupon code can help monitor customer behavior more precisely. Having this degree of flexibility requires a good content library, clear action plans and offer criteria, and a “continuous improvement” mentality.</li>
    <li><em>Marketing.</em> Like any event, good marketing drives performance, and—as experience shows—companies often don’t invest enough time or resources to get their marketing right and can “starve” even the best marketing efforts. To maximize views, it’s crucial to take an omnichannel approach, alerting target audiences to an upcoming show through newsletters, emails, websites, apps, push notifications, and social media and providing links and information on paid social media. The best producers have an intimate knowledge of the features (such as countdown clocks) offered by the chosen livestreaming platform, and they invest the time to understand which websites their target audience frequents and place ads there.</li>
</ul>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-disruptor1up mck-o-md-center mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom mck-u-screen-only" data-layer-region="disruptor-1up"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-md mdc-u-grid-col-lg-12 mdc-u-grid-col-md-12 "><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-lg-span-4 mdc-u-grid-col-md-span-5 Disruptor1Up_mck-c-disruptor1up__image___2Gc4"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture"><img alt="Building an e-commerce business: Lessons on moving fast" src="/~/media/mckinsey/business%20functions/mckinsey%20digital/our%20insights/building%20an%20e%20commerce%20business%20lessons%20on%20moving%20fast/ecommerce-1536x1536.jpg?cq=50&mh=145&car=16:9&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-lg-span-8 mdc-u-grid-col-md-span-7"><header data-component="mdc-c-header" class="mdc-c-header"><div class="mdc-c-header__block___i1Lg-_990311c"><h3 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c"><div>Building an e-commerce business: Lessons on moving fast</div></h3></div></header><div data-component="mdc-c-link-container" class="mdc-c-link-container___xefGu_990311c mdc-c-link-container--display-column___X0HDD_990311c mck-c-disruptor1up__content Disruptor1Up_mck-c-disruptor1up__content--links__VV4lE mdc-u-grid-gutter-md"><a data-component="mdc-c-link" href="/capabilities/mckinsey-digital/our-insights/building-an-e-commerce-business-lessons-on-moving-fast" class="mdc-c-link-cta___NBQVi_990311c"><span class="mdc-c-link__label___Pfqtd_990311c">Read the article</span><span data-component="mdc-c-icon" class="mdc-c-icon___oi7ef_990311c mck-link-arrow-right-icon"></span></a></div></div></div></div>
<h2>What’s next for live commerce?</h2>
<p>Our observations suggest we can expect to see the following developments in the next few years:</p>
<p><em>Micro- and nano-influencers.</em> Big-name influencers and celebrities with millions of followers are expensive to hire and don’t always make the best hosts. Using influencers with a few thousand dedicated followers can generate a more intimate and trusted connection with audiences at lower cost. According to one survey, the engagement rates for nano-influencers on Instagram are ten times those for mega and macro influencers.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="64ce5629-b3e1-46e5-adfc-0297d9c6ce8e"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">15</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="64ce5629-b3e1-46e5-adfc-0297d9c6ce8e" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Shane Barker, “Why nano-influencers are a great addition to your marketing strategy,” <em>BetterMarketing</em>, January 31, 2020, bettermarketing.pub.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p><em>Expansion into new sectors.</em> As live commerce increases its reach, industries such as healthcare, engineering, finance—and, in time, B2B sectors—are likely to move in. For example, a leading tech company is planning to use its livestreaming platform to provide health-related content and services such as consultations and appointment scheduling.</p>
<p><em>Innovative formats.</em> Augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) can make the shopping experience even more immersive and enable buyers to see a product from every angle. In an early example, Ulta Beauty teamed up with AR developer Perfect Corp to include virtual try-ons in its “Beauty School” livestream. In the future, consumers may be able to have virtual face-to-face conversations with a show host just as though they were speaking in a store.</p>
<hr>
<p>Live commerce has become table stakes for successful consumer companies in China and much of the rest of Asia and is rapidly spreading to Europe and the United States. Some pioneers have achieved extraordinary reach and impact. Others wanting to follow their example will need to move quickly to design their own experiments to get the most out of this dynamic new channel.</p></div><div commerce is transforming the shopping experience","displayName":"Its showtime How live commerce is transforming the shopping experience","fields":null,"databaseName":"web","deviceId":"fe5d7fdf-89c0-4d99-9aa3-b5fbd009c9f3","itemId":"b932a40c-9ef1-418f-bab5-f126163c4825","itemLanguage":"en","itemVersion":1,"layoutId":"ae753eb4-a035-40b4-83bf-4b4438df6742","templateId":"683910db-02ba-40ba-92e7-726c880160a9","templateName":"ArticleJSS","placeholders":{"jss-main":[{"uid":"232bb7e9-289f-492d-a916-2b6185e44a84","componentName":"ArticleTemplate","dataSource":"","fields":{"data":{"articleTemplate":{"title":{"jsonValue":{"value":"It\u0026rsquo;s showtime! How live commerce is transforming the shopping experience"}},"sEOTitle":{"value":"Live commerce is transforming online shopping"},"description":{"jsonValue":{"value":"Blending entertainment with instant purchasing, live commerce offers retailers, brands, and digital platforms a new channel with enormous scope for creating value."}},"sEODescription":{"value":"Blending entertainment with instant purchasing, live commerce offers retailers, brands, and digital platforms a new channel for creating value."},"displayDate":{"jsonValue":{"value":"2021-07-21T00:00:00Z"}},"body":{"value":"[[DownloadsSidebar]]\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe arrival of Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s Taobao Live in May 2016\u003c/strong\u003e marked the opening of a new chapter in sales. The Chinese retail giant had pioneered a powerful new approach: linking up an online livestream broadcast with an e-commerce store to allow viewers to watch and shop at the same time. Live commerce quickly established itself as a fixture in sales campaigns for Singles\u0026rsquo; Day\u0026mdash;a major shopping event in China\u0026mdash;and, more broadly, as a reliable digital tool for boosting customer engagement and sales. In 2020, the first 30 minutes of Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s Singles\u0026rsquo; Day presales campaign on Taobao Live generated an impressive $7.5 billion in total transaction value.[[footnote 1]] Welcome to the next wave of the e-commerce revolution.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[sidebar authors]]\n\u003cp\u003eLive commerce combines instant purchasing of a featured product and audience participation through a chat function or reaction buttons. In China, live commerce has transformed the retail industry and established itself as a major sales channel in less than five years. In a 2020 survey, two-thirds of Chinese consumers said they had bought products via livestream in the past year.[[footnote 2]] While retailers overall in the West are still behind China in the pursuit of live commerce, early movers are also starting to rack up significant sales.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHow exactly this new channel will develop remains to be seen. What is clear is that it holds enormous long-term potential for brands and e-commerce platforms alike. If China\u0026rsquo;s experience is any guide, our analysis indicates that live-commerce-initiated sales could account for as much as 10 to 20 percent of all e-commerce by 2026.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eHow does live commerce create value?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLive commerce can help brands, retailers, and marketplaces primarily in two areas:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eAccelerating conversion.\u003c/em\u003e Live commerce is entertaining and immersive, keeping viewers watching longer. It also telescopes \u003ca href=\"/capabilities/growth-marketing-and-sales/our-insights/the-new-consumer-decision-journey\"\u003ecustomer decision journeys\u003c/a\u003e from awareness to purchase. Time-limited tactics such as one-off coupons can be used to generate a sense of urgency. Companies report conversion rates approaching 30 percent\u0026mdash;up to ten times higher than in \u003ca href=\"/featured-insights/mckinsey-explainers/what-is-e-commerce\"\u003econventional e-commerce\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[exhibit 1]]\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eImproving brand appeal and differentiation.\u003c/em\u003e Done well, live commerce increases a brand\u0026rsquo;s appeal and distinctiveness and pulls in additional web traffic. It can strengthen positioning among existing customers and attract new ones, especially young people keen on innovative shopping formats and experiences. Some companies are seeing their share of younger audiences increase by up to 20 percent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eA rapidly growing channel\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLive commerce has evolved rapidly in China, taking less than five years to develop into an innovative sales channel with an estimated penetration of 10 percent.[[footnote 3]] The value of China\u0026rsquo;s live-commerce market grew at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of more than 280 percent between 2017 and 2020, to reach an estimated $171 billion in 2020 (Exhibit 1).[[footnote 4]] This growth spurt has been intensified by the COVID-19 pandemic, and Chinese sales are expected to reach $423 billion by 2022.[[footnote 5]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe product categories most often showcased in live commerce are apparel and fashion, with a 36 percent share, followed by beauty products and food, with roughly 7 percent each (Exhibit 2). Consumer electronics account for some 5 percent, and furnishing and home decor for almost 4 percent.[[footnote 6]]\u003c/p\u003e\n[[exhibit 2]]\n[[sidebar 1]]\n\u003cp\u003eIn terms of demographics, Generation Z and millennials dominate, although live commerce is starting to attract middle-aged and more-senior consumers. By March 2020, live commerce was used by 265 million people\u0026mdash;almost 30 percent of Chinese Internet users.[[footnote 7]] Taobao remains the world\u0026rsquo;s biggest player (see sidebar \u0026ldquo;Key facts on the world\u0026rsquo;s biggest live-commerce player\u0026rdquo;), with a market share of 35 percent.[[footnote 8]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFollowing China\u0026rsquo;s lead, Western brands, retailers, and marketplaces are establishing their own live-commerce ventures and events to promote their products, especially in beauty and fashion. Among the earliest adopters was German beauty retailer Douglas, which streams several shows a week in a range of formats, from workshops with experts to talks with influencers, and reports conversion rates of up to 40 percent.[[footnote 9]] On the fashion front, Tommy Hilfiger recently extended its livestream program to Europe and North America following successes in China, where one show reportedly attracted an audience of 14 million and sold 1,300 hoodies in two minutes.[[footnote 10]] And in December 2020, Walmart piloted a livestream fashion event on TikTok that netted seven times more viewers than expected and enabled it to add 25 percent to its TikTok follower base.[[footnote 11]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA plethora of specialist start-ups have also emerged, including NTWRK, which features shows where guests talk about limited-availability streetwear, and Buywith, where viewers watch hosts browsing the e-commerce platform and chatting via webcam.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMeanwhile, consumer demand is building: a recent survey found that almost a quarter of adults outside China would like to discover new products via a livestream featuring an influencer or brand representative.[[footnote 12]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eStarting out in live commerce\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile live commerce is still an emerging channel with many unknowns, some best practices are emerging, and lessons from e-commerce are proving to be applicable. Brands will need a thoughtful approach to learning how to use the medium\u0026mdash;it can be expensive to do live commerce during Singles\u0026rsquo; Day, for example, so best to try low-risk options first\u0026mdash;and evolve their capabilities as they learn (see sidebar \u0026ldquo;Three live-commerce archetypes\u0026rdquo;).\u003c/p\u003e\n[[sidebar 2]]\n\u003cp\u003eOur analysis has shown that focusing on answering the following questions can help put brands on the right track.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eWhich product and audience?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eConsider which stage a product has reached in its life cycle. Are you seeking to generate instant feedback on a new product, clear stock of an older item, or give a bestseller an extra boost? Our observations suggest that live events can be highly effective for creating awareness and prompting trial but less so for solidifying loyalty. It\u0026rsquo;s worth noting that many impulse shoppers are one-time buyers, so a newly attracted audience can\u0026rsquo;t be taken for granted; keeping it will take work. Similarly, our experience has shown that shoppers often come from a very different demographic than the brand\u0026rsquo;s typical target group.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTo ensure that your show attracts the consumer segments most relevant to your brand, it\u0026rsquo;s critical to know who makes up your audience, what matters to them, and how to get their attention. Using analytics sources and tools to understand who has watched your content in the past can help you build up \u0026ldquo;personas\u0026rdquo; of potential customers to guide your choices on your target demographic. In broad terms, Generation X and Generation Z shop\u0026mdash;and spend\u0026mdash;more online than other groups, but it pays to dig into the data at a more granular level.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn fashion, beauty, and luxury goods, for instance, millennials are the top-spending cohort, with 31 percent of the US market, according to McKinsey analysis. Boomers come in second, with 25 percent, followed by Gen X at 24 percent and Gen Z at 20 percent. But category by category, the picture becomes more complex: Generation Z spends more on luxury apparel and accessories than millennials do, for instance (averaging $926 and $789, respectively).[[footnote 13]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eKnowing your audience also means knowing who and what most influence them. Adults in Gen Z derive 75 percent of their influences from social media, online content, and celebrities; millennials are a bit behind, at 63 percent, followed by Gen Z under-18s at 53 percent and Gen X at 49 percent (Exhibit 3). As these younger cohorts age, their spending power will grow, as will their presence. Millennials, for instance, are projected to account for half of the population globally by 2030.[[footnote 14]]\u003c/p\u003e\n[[exhibit 3]]\n\u003cp\u003eProduct launches or presentations can attract attention to a new product and convert interest instantly into sales, making them a good choice for seasonal marketing campaigns and exclusive or special deals. To trigger impulse purchases, products need to look good on small and large screens and be positioned as good value for the money.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eWhich format?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTo set up a livestream event, companies typically engage a key opinion leader (KOL) or key opinion consumer (KOC) to host the show, introduce the product, and interact with the audience to trigger sales. Several popular formats have emerged, each with its own strengths:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eTutorials,\u003c/em\u003e such as makeup demonstrations hosted by models, are effective not only in showing audiences how to apply or use a specific product but also in suggesting how to combine it with other products, opening up cross-selling opportunities.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eInterviews\u003c/em\u003e with a big name or influencer from a relevant segment feel more personal, authentic, and genuine than product launches and can be good for building awareness and driving traffic.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u0026ldquo;Behind-the-scenes\u0026rdquo;\u003c/em\u003e videos offering the inside story of a product or company help build brand image and loyalty in a target segment\u0026mdash;an ethical fashion retailer, for instance, might showcase its sustainable supply chain to environmentally and socially conscious consumers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eRegardless of format, many successful events feature interactive elements such as games, quizzes, and giveaways to keep viewers engaged and entertained. They maintain high production values in photography, location, lighting, and sound and ensure that scripts are not overly focused on the product.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eWhich enablers?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePlanning a live-commerce event also involves deciding on the following:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eTechnology.\u003c/em\u003e The key technology choice is which platform or marketplace to use for hosting the stream and providing e-commerce functionality. Some providers offer one of these functions; others, such as Instagram and Facebook, offer both. The right choice depends on a business\u0026rsquo;s level of maturity with live commerce. It also involves considering which technology provides the biggest target audience, which features it offers (live chat, \u0026ldquo;likes,\u0026rdquo; and so on), and the level of commission to be paid. Companies with more experience in live commerce can switch to an off-the-shelf solution, such as Livescale or Bambuser, that allows them to tailor the live-shopping experience to suit their brand, syndicate to multiple social-media channels, and offer their customers seamless purchasing from the same page. Companies that want to fully customize the customer experience and functionality often build their own solution.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eTracking.\u003c/em\u003e As in e-commerce, effective monitoring and measuring of event impact by audience, day part, and so on is crucial to understanding what works and what doesn\u0026rsquo;t. It is important that the live-commerce operating model be flexible enough to act quickly on that data. After a show, for example, it\u0026rsquo;s possible to send a link to a recording of the show to a viewer who watched for just 20 seconds, or to offer someone who stayed for ten minutes a discount to convert their interest into a purchase. A one-off coupon code can help monitor customer behavior more precisely. Having this degree of flexibility requires a good content library, clear action plans and offer criteria, and a \u0026ldquo;continuous improvement\u0026rdquo; mentality.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eMarketing.\u003c/em\u003e Like any event, good marketing drives performance, and\u0026mdash;as experience shows\u0026mdash;companies often don\u0026rsquo;t invest enough time or resources to get their marketing right and can \u0026ldquo;starve\u0026rdquo; even the best marketing efforts. To maximize views, it\u0026rsquo;s crucial to take an omnichannel approach, alerting target audiences to an upcoming show through newsletters, emails, websites, apps, push notifications, and social media and providing links and information on paid social media. The best producers have an intimate knowledge of the features (such as countdown clocks) offered by the chosen livestreaming platform, and they invest the time to understand which websites their target audience frequents and place ads there.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n[[disruptor1up readnext]]\n\u003ch2\u003eWhat\u0026rsquo;s next for live commerce?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOur observations suggest we can expect to see the following developments in the next few years:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eMicro- and nano-influencers.\u003c/em\u003e Big-name influencers and celebrities with millions of followers are expensive to hire and don\u0026rsquo;t always make the best hosts. Using influencers with a few thousand dedicated followers can generate a more intimate and trusted connection with audiences at lower cost. According to one survey, the engagement rates for nano-influencers on Instagram are ten times those for mega and macro influencers.[[footnote 15]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eExpansion into new sectors.\u003c/em\u003e As live commerce increases its reach, industries such as healthcare, engineering, finance\u0026mdash;and, in time, B2B sectors\u0026mdash;are likely to move in. For example, a leading tech company is planning to use its livestreaming platform to provide health-related content and services such as consultations and appointment scheduling.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eInnovative formats.\u003c/em\u003e Augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) can make the shopping experience even more immersive and enable buyers to see a product from every angle. In an early example, Ulta Beauty teamed up with AR developer Perfect Corp to include virtual try-ons in its \u0026ldquo;Beauty School\u0026rdquo; livestream. In the future, consumers may be able to have virtual face-to-face conversations with a show host just as though they were speaking in a store.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003chr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLive commerce has become table stakes for successful consumer companies in China and much of the rest of Asia and is rapidly spreading to Europe and the United States. Some pioneers have achieved extraordinary reach and impact. Others wanting to follow their example will need to move quickly to design their own experiments to get the most out of this dynamic new channel.\u003c/p\u003e"},"isFullScreenInteractive":{"boolValue":false},"hideStickySocialShareBar":{"boolValue":false},"desktopID":{"value":""},"mobileID":{"value":""},"desktopURL":{"value":""},"mobileURL":{"value":""},"desktopPaddingPercentage":{"value":""},"mobilePaddingPercentage":{"value":""},"desktopOverrideHeight":{"value":""},"mobileOverrideHeight":{"value":""},"cerosOembedURL":{"value":""},"cerosRenderMode":{"targetItem":null},"cerosBackgroundColor":{"targetItem":null},"hideByLine":{"boolValue":false},"tableOfContentsTitle":{"value":"TABLE OF CONTENTS"},"accessStatus":{"targetItem":{"key":{"value":"RegisteredUsers"},"value":{"value":"Registered Users"}}},"articleType":{"targetItem":{"displayName":"Article"}},"hasSpecialReport":{"boolValue":false},"contentType":{"targetItem":{"displayName":"Article"}},"sourcePublication":{"targetItem":null},"externalPublication":{"value":""},"mobileReady":{"boolValue":true},"forClientsOnly":{"boolValue":false},"excludeFromClientLink":{"boolValue":false},"originalPublishDate":{"jsonValue":{"value":"2021-07-21T00:00:00Z"}},"footnotes":{"value":"\u003col\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eJane Zhang, \u0026ldquo;Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s Taobao Live hits US$7.5 billion in first 30 minutes of presales for Singles\u0026rsquo; Day,\u0026rdquo; \u003cem\u003eSouth China Morning Post\u003c/em\u003e, October 29, 2020, scmp.com.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u0026ldquo;Chinese consumers rally for Singles\u0026rsquo; Day but plan to shun foreign brands, says AlixPartners survey,\u0026rdquo; AlixPartners, October 28, 2020, alixpartners.com.\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eMcKinsey analysis based on numbers from iResearch. Companies tend to fall into three basic archetypes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e1. BASIC: Testing the waters\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eHave infrequent streams focused on one to five products\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eRely on the technology of one social-media channel (such as TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook) or marketplace (such as Amazon Live, Taobao, or Tmall)\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eProvide high-level brand guidelines to a key opinion leader (KOL) or key opinion customer (KOC) who (with their agency) owns content creation\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eTrack performance of livestreams with key performance indicators (KPIs) in place for numbers of views, conversion rates, and best-selling products\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e2. GOOD: Making live commerce a pillar of e-commerce\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eExperiment with a regular schedule of live events with varying products, formats, and target audiences\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eIntegrate livestreaming into its own website or e-commerce experience to \u0026ldquo;own\u0026rdquo; the customer\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eTrack livestream performance using real-time predictive analytics to derive insights into audiences, content, products, formats, hosts, and timing\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eUse a dedicated in-house team or agency staff to plan and develop content for livestreams, including storylines, scripts, and hosts or influencers\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eMake a full-time team responsible for managing the live-commerce channel\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eSet up automated performance-marketing campaigns to drive target traffic to relevant streams\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e3. GREAT: Scaling up to an innovative data-driven business\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eBroadcast frequent livestreams across multiple channels using various formats targeting different audience segments and product categories\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eUse analytics-derived insights and machine learning to develop automated real-time prompts for optimizing livestreams as they go out\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eIntegrate tech innovations such as augmented and virtual reality into livestreams to make them more immersive for viewers\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eHave a fully-fledged live-commerce department with a broad network of KOLs and KOCs who have proved they can run livestreams on their
